ffffs002 Alchemical Fire
Rarity: Rare
Looking for Inventory Management? Please Login w/ "Remember Me?" option selected.
Alchemical Fire
EQUIP: Any.
UNEQUIP: Drop.
EFFECT: When equipped, place the Alchemical Fire in the circle on the back of this card with the arrow indicator pointing to the effect of your choice. // FREE: Roll a d6. Turn the Alchemical Fire clockwise a number of effects equal to half the result. Until you roll again, attacks made by the equipped character have the listed effect. Top Left: Damage dealt is penetrating damage.
Top Right: After resolutions, you may deal 1 damage to each character adjacent to a hit target.
Bottom Right: Give a hit character a Fire token. At the beginning of your turn, deal that character 1 penetrating damage. Remove the Fire token when that character clears action tokens.
Bottom Left: Until your next turn, hit characters modify their attack -2.

Light Object
10 Points
Figure Errata
Changed Effect Text
Trade Alchemical Fire Want Alchemical Fire

July 3, 2022
Hellboy the Bellboy
Has now been errata'd. Fire token now only does damage at the beginning of your turn, no longer every turn.
March 5, 2021
Wistler
tidge, i hate to ruin your day but the effects of this Equipment are only applied to attacks made by the equipped character then no Penetrating Poison. "...Until you roll again, attacks made by the equipped character have the listed effect."
March 2, 2021
tidge
I definitely get the sense that this can make many characters better, with a couple of caveats: (1) Passive damage dealers (e.g. Poison) will benefit most from the Penetrating damage, but obviously all attackers like this. (2) The Fire token(s!) can really spoil someones day, if applied to the 'correct' targets. The other options seem to be too situational to hope for. Damage reducers are common so an adjacent 1-click hardly seems great, and hoping to reduce an opposing figure's attack value for a single turn by successfully hitting them first seems primed for a cascading failure.
February 26, 2021
vexxillion
The Fire token mode on the card says "At the beginning of EACH turn" instead of "At the beginning of YOUR turn." I'm finding it difficult to think of a figure this doesn't benefit in any way. Since you can choose which effect to start on (keep in mind you must still roll before granted any effects) and also get to choose the direction of rotation, with a little finesse you should get your desired effect 66% of the time on your first roll. Very nice equipment!
